unit_learning_outcomes.description: Assess and analyse stakeholder interests relevant to corporate development strategies involving mergers, acquisitions and divestments with a view to creating value for the firm and arising benefits to its stakeholders.
Examine key factors relevant to corporate transactions in order to make well developed and commercially robust business decisions involving mergers, acquisitions and divestments.
Explore issues relating to transaction implementation processes to ensure the success of the corporate transaction.

enrolment_rules.description: ((MGSM840 or MMBA8040) and (MGSM835 or MMBA8035)) or (AFCP801 or AFCP8001 or AFCP8102)

assessments.description: Students will submit a 3,000 word report analysing a case study.
Two quizzes consisting of multiple choice/short answer questions will be held online and/or in class.

Students will work in small groups to produce a Report and a Board Presentation that addresses a proposed transaction (as developed by each group). This includes the submission of a Report (MSWord or similar, maximum 4,000 words) and an Executive Summary Board Presentation (voice over Powerpoint or similar, maximum of 12 slides)

data.unit_offering_text:
Term 1, Intensive attendance, North Ryde*
Term 3, Intensive attendance, North Ryde*
Term 3, Special circumstances
Term 1, Special circumstances

* This unit offering is subject to a quota. Limited places are available. Please refer to the Faculty for further information.
data.description: The study of corporate mergers/acquisitions is truly interdisciplinary. The unit will draw on material from the fields of strategy, accounting, law, economics and corporate finance. The unit broadly covers each of the following topics: (1) Evaluation of the strategy and motives for acquisitions; (2) Valuing targets to determine optimum acquisition price; (3) Financing considerations for acquisitions; (4) Deal design and structure; (5) The common forms of corporate combinations and their motivation; (6) Due diligence; and (7) transctions planning and implementation.
data.title: Corporate Acquisitions
